result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan M. Anderson

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:28am Cases called: 22CF60 & 22CF464. Defendant Ryan M. Anderson in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Ryan M. Anderson.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for an arraignment on these cases. 

Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas Parties are close to an agreement. The agreement contemplates a DAGP. Defense requests a status conference/possible plea
Plea Hearing: 11/10/22 at 11am
Arraignment on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:00 am cases 22CF60 and 22CF464 called. Defendant Ryan M. Anderson in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Ryan M. Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants are quashed in both files. Defense enters not guilty pleas which are accepted by the Court. 
Cases referred to Branch 5 to schedule ARGN.
Return on warrant on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:34 AM cases 22CF60, 22CF464 called.  Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video via Zoom for Ryan M. Anderson. Defendant Ryan M. Anderson not in court. Attorney Rivard states he was unable to make contact with Defendant. State requests warrants.

Warrants ordered.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases called at 10:18 AM - 22CF60 and 22CF464)
Defendant Ryan M. Anderson appears in custody via videoconference from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Francis Rivard appears in the courtroom.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is scheduled to be released on July 28, 2022.  Offer is for a Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement.  Defendant advised of his right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF464.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing - waiver accepted by Court.  
Status Conference/Arraignment: August 19, 2022 at 9:30 AM (In person)
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

(Cases 22CF60, 22CF464 are called at 9:52 AM - by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan M. Anderson in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Ryan M. Anderson. 
22CF60- Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts. 
Status Conference in 22CF60 and Hearing in 22CF464 to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

(Case called at 11:38 AM) Defendant Ryan Anderson appears in person with Attorney Francis Rivard. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. Court orders previously ordered bond remains in effect. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
Arraignment on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:31 AM.
Defendant Ryan M. Anderson not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Ryan M. Anderson.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rivard has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and notes he does not have a working phone number for the Defendant.
State requests warrant. Warrant ordered.

Order on Petition for Appointment of Attorney - Return to Sender, Moved Left no Address, Unable to Forward

Attorney Francis Rivard at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 03/04/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Same as Complaint.

2:05 PM Defendant Ryan M. Anderson appeared in court without counsel, Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant would like to hire an attorney in the future. Defendant will not waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing to proceed. 
State calls Officer Paul Asselin, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. 
No cross examination. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over to Br. 5 for Arraignment.

Conditions: 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:14 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan M. Anderson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Ryan M. Anderson. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions: 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
